It can be used for green bonds or for [OATi](http://www.aft.gouv.fr/en/encours-detaille-oati) linked to French inflation (e.g. [0.55% Mar 2039](http://www.aft.gouv.fr/en/titre/fr001400ikw5)), with the usual marker, `FR`, being used for non-green or for [OAT€i](http://www.aft.gouv.fr/en/encours-detaille-oatei) linked to European inflation (e.g. [0.1% July 2053](http://www.aft.gouv.fr/en/titre/fr0014008181)). Of course, the alternate marker can be used for other purposes.

Notes.Mnemonic: Only large currency with prominent diagonal cross in [flag](http://www.jdawiseman.com/papers/union-jack/union-jack.html), though the diagonal has been thickened. In [flag](http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Union_Jack) red and blue.
Notes.UseFor: Some data is reported for England and/or Scotland, rather than for the UK as a whole, and some sports are organised at the same level. So there are same-shape markers for the UK’s immediately sub-national divisions: England = `GB_ENG`; Scotland = `GB_SCT`; Wales = `GB_WLS`; Northern Ireland = `GB_NIR`; and the jurisdiction England & Wales = `GB_EAW` (the last of these being standard for green bonds and for [old‑style 8‑month ILGs](http://www.jdawiseman.com/papers/finmkts/gilt_statics_non-conventionals.html#ILG_8M)).

Notes.Mnemonic: Shape from `GBP` marker; colours from the [flag of Scotland](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Flag_of_Scotland).

Shape from `GBP` marker; green and red colours from the [flag of Wales](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Flag_of_Wales).
Shape from `GBP` marker; red from the [flag of England](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Flag_of_England), green from the [flag of Wales](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Flag_of_Wales).
Notes.UseFor: Used for the jurisdiction England and Wales, and also for green gilts, and for [old‑style 8‑month ILGs](http://www.jdawiseman.com/papers/finmkts/gilt_statics_non-conventionals.html#ILG_8M)).

Notes.Mnemonic: Crosses from the [flag of Georgia](http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Flag_of_Georgia_(country)).
Notes.Design: At the likely size of a marker, the curve in the short sides would cause an indentation of less than a pixel, so those sides have been made straight.

From the [flag of South Korea](http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Flag_of_South_Korea).
Notes.Design: The shape, but not the colour, has the desired rotational symmetry.

Notes.Mnemonic: Black isosceles trapezium in hoist of [flag of Kuwait](http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Flag_of_Kuwait), for symmetry duplicated back-to-back, in flag colours.

KZT.Svg: <svg width='10' height='10' viewBox='-1 -1 2 2' id='KZT' xmlns='http://www.w3.org/2000/svg'><circle fill='#00AEC7' r='1'/><path id='KZT-a' fill='#F6E500' d='M.70711 .70711L.50683 .22361A.21677 .21677 0 1 0 .22361 .50683Z'/><use href='#KZT-a' transform='scale(-1,1)'/><use href='#KZT-a' transform='scale(1,-1)'/><use href='#KZT-a' transform='scale(-1,-1)'/></svg>

Notes.Mnemonic: [Flag of Kazakhstan](http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Flag_of_Kazakhstan), simplified and rearranged.
From the [flag of North Macedonia](http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Flag_of_North_Macedonia#/media/File:Construction_sheet_of_the_flag_of_North_Macedonia.svg).
Cross of Malta, from its [‘Variant’ flag](http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Flag_of_Malta#/media/File:Civil_Ensign_of_Malta.svg).
Eight-pointed star from [Mexican naval jack](http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Mexican_Navy); [flag](http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Flag_of_Mexico) colours.

Star from the [flag of Malaysia](http://web.archive.org/web/20120318034534/http://pmr.penerangan.gov.my/index.php/maklumat-kenegaraan/194-bendera-malaysia.html), simplified from 14 outer points to 14 vertices (i.e., 7 outer points).
Notes.Design: The rectangle has rotational symmetry of order 2, the star of order 7, with the same centres, but the whole does not have rotational symmetry.

Notes.Mnemonic: Shape from `NL` marker; the colours switched.
Notes.UseFor: The Netherlands’ alternate marker, for green bonds or for other purposes.

Notes.Mnemonic: [Netherlands naval jack](http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Flag_of_the_Netherlands), in Dutch orange.
Notes.UseFor: The Netherlands has an alternate marker, `NL_2`, which can be used for green bonds, or for other purposes.

Notes.Mnemonic: Two triangles, back to back, from the shape of the [flag of Nepal](http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Flag_of_Nepal), and inside two white triangles, from the rays of the sun and moon.

OMR.Svg: <svg width='9.2' height='9.2' viewBox='-6 -6 12 12' id='OMR' xmlns='http://www.w3.org/2000/svg'><path fill='#C8102E' d='M6 6V-6H-6V6Z'/><path fill='gold' d='M0 1L-4 5 -5 4 -1 0 -5 -4l1 -1 4 4L4 -5l1 1L1 0 5 4 4 5Z'/></svg>

Notes.Mnemonic: From the badge of the Albusaidi Dynasty in the hoist of the [flag of Oman](http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Flag_of_Oman), with the crossed swords, but without the ornate horsebit, and without the asymmetry of the curved dagger.
Big star from the [flag of the Philippines](http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Flag_of_the_Philippines#Construction), simplified, in flag gold and blue.

From [naval jack of Poland](http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/List_of_Polish_naval_and_maritime_flags#/media/File:Naval_Jack_of_Poland.svg); colours from [flag](http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Flag_of_Poland).
From the [flag of Qatar](http://www.vexilla-mundi.com/qatar_flag.html).

RON.Svg: <svg width='9.6' height='10.8' viewBox='-8 -9 16 18' id='RON' xmlns='http://www.w3.org/2000/svg'><path fill='#002B7F' d='M8 9H6V8H-6V9H-8V7h1V-7H-8V-9h2v1H6V-9H8v2H7V7H8Z'/><path fill='#FCD116' d='M5 6V-6H-5V6Z'/><path fill='#CE1126' d='M3 4V-4H-3V4Z'/></svg>

Notes.Mnemonic: [Palace of Parliament](http://goo.gl/maps/RQzKYRL8b2pud8Bk8), Bucharest, in [Romanian-flag](http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Flag_of_Romania) blue-yellow-red.
Based on the medal [Hero of the Russian Federation](http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Hero_of_the_Russian_Federation).
Notes.Design: Measurements from the [wikipedia image](http://upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/c/cb/RIAN_archive_470774_Gold_Star_medal_%28cropped%29.jpg) being consistent with an inner radius of 0.527. For a full-symmetry five-pointed star, area = outer · inner · √(10 − 2√5) · 5/4, the constant being ≈ 2.939. For a regular 5⁄2 star the inner radius is ½ (3 − √5) ≈ 0.382 ⟹ with same outer radius this RUB star would have an area ≈ 0.527 / 0.382 ≈ 1.38 times bigger. Hence it is slighty smaller than the other five-pointed stars.

SDG.Svg: <svg width='9.2' height='9.2' viewBox='-5 -5 10 10' id='SDG' xmlns='http://www.w3.org/2000/svg'><path d='M5 5V-5H-5V5Z'/><path fill='#FFF' d='M4 -3v2L-1 4H-3Z M4 1V3L3 4H1Z M-4 3V1L1 -4H3Z M-4 -1V-3l1 -1h2Z'/></svg>

Notes.Mnemonic: Inspired by the wings of the [Secretary bird](http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Secretary_bird) in the [emblem of Sudan](http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Emblem_of_Sudan).
Star from Slovenia’s [flag](http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Flag_of_Slovenia)’s [coat of arms](http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Slovenia#/media/File:Coat_of_arms_of_Slovenia.svg).
Notes.Design: There does not seem to be an official specification of the inner radius of the star; the [wikimedia](http://upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/8/8f/Coat_of_arms_of_Slovenia.svg) version uses an inner radius of ½, also used here.

EUR.Svg: <svg width='10' height='10' viewBox='-10 -10 20 20' id='EUR' xmlns='http://www.w3.org/2000/svg'><circle fill='#F3F' r='10'/><circle fill='#FFF' r='8'/><path fill='#F3F' d='M9 1V-1H-9V1Z'/></svg>

Notes.Mnemonic: [Currency symbol](http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/File:Euro_Construction.svg) = €, with the circle completed; the two lines across simplified to one, placed between the original two. Pink not in any of member flags, so is a neutral choice, and is helpfully distinctive.

LU.Svg: <svg width='16.6' height='8.3' viewBox='-54 -27 108 54' id='LU' xmlns='http://www.w3.org/2000/svg'><path fill='#EF3340' d='M54 0L0 27 -54 0 0 -27Z'/><path fill='#FFF' d='M38 0L0 19 -38 0 0 -19Z'/><path fill='#00A3E0' d='M20 0L0 10 -20 0 0 -10Z'/></svg>

Notes.Design: The [wikipedia picture](http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Luxembourg_City_Hall#/media/File:Luxemb_City_Hotel_de_ville_01.jpg) suggested an aspect ratio of 4∶9, [trimmed](https://github.com/jdaw1/chart_markers/blob/main/Documentation/ChartMarkers_Description.md#aspect) to 1∶2.

HR.Svg: <svg width='9.2' height='9.2' viewBox='-3 -3 6 6' id='HR' xmlns='http://www.w3.org/2000/svg'><path fill='#FFF' d='M1 3H-1L-3 1V-1L-1 -3H1L3 -1V1Z'/><path fill='red' d='M3 1V3H1V-3H3v2H-3V-3h2V3H-3V1Z'/></svg>

CZK.Svg: <svg width='14.4' height='9.6' viewBox='-81 -54 162 108' id='CZK' xmlns='http://www.w3.org/2000/svg'><path fill='#11457E' d='M81 0L0 54 -81 0 0 -54Z'/><path fill='#D7141A' d='M57 0L0 38 -57 0 0 -38Z'/><path fill='#FFF' d='M30 0L0 20 -30 0 0 -20Z'/></svg>

Triangle from the hoist of the [flag of Palestine](http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Flag_of_Palestine), for symmetry duplicated back-to-back, in flag colours.

_ESM.Svg: <svg width='9.2' height='9.2' viewBox='-5 -5 10 10' id='_ESM' xmlns='http://www.w3.org/2000/svg'><rect fill='#004494' x='-5' y='-5' width='10' height='10' rx='2'/><path fill='#FFF' d='M3 1V3H-3V1L3 -1V-3H-3v2Z'/><path fill='#FFD500' d='M3 1V-1H-3V1Z'/></svg>

Notes.Mnemonic: [Logo](http://www.esm.europa.eu/themes/custom/esm_wop_theme/logo.svg) of the [European Stability Mechanism](http://www.esm.europa.eu/), simplified and symmetrified. Bloomberg ticker = <kbd>ESM Corp</kbd>

_EFSF.Svg: <svg width='9.2' height='9.2' viewBox='-5 -5 10 10' id='_EFSF' xmlns='http://www.w3.org/2000/svg'><rect fill='#00A3E0' x='-5' y='-5' width='10' height='10' rx='2'/><path fill='#FFF' d='M3 1V3H-3V1L3 -1V-3H-3v2Z'/><path fill='#EF3340' d='M3 1V-1H-3V1Z'/></svg>

Notes.Mnemonic: The marker of the [European Financial Stability Facility](http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/European_Financial_Stability_Facility) has the same shape as that of the `_ESM`, as the two share staff and premises. The EFSF is a Luxembourg company, from the flag of which come the colours (whereas the ESM is an intergovernmental institution). They are different entities with different credit ratings, so must have different markers. EFSF’s Bbg ticker = <kbd>EFSF Corp</kbd>

Notes.Mnemonic: Based on the ‘K’ of the [logo](http://www.kfw.de/Technische-Medien/Logos/kfw_logo_320-2x.svg) of the [Kreditanstalt für Wiederaufbau](http://www.kfw.de/kfw.de-2.html) (‘Credit Institute for Reconstruction’). Bbg ticker = <kbd>KFW Corp</kbd>

XK.Svg: <svg width='9.2' height='9.2' viewBox='-5 -5 10 10' id='XK' xmlns='http://www.w3.org/2000/svg'><path fill='#244AA5' d='M5 5V-5H-5V5Z'/><path fill='#D0A650' d='M4 1L-1 4 -4 -1 1 -4Z'/></svg>

Notes.Mnemonic: Simplified [flag of Kosovo](http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Flag_of_Kosovo).
Notes.Design: The [XK](http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/XK_(user_assigned_code)) identifier isn’t official [ISO 3166‑1](http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/ISO_3166-1_alpha-2), but is (or has been) used in that style by the [UK](http://www.gov.uk/government/publications/uk-trade-tariff-country-and-currency-codes/uk-trade-tariff-country-and-currency-codes), [Canada](http://www.cbsa-asfc.gc.ca/prog/cers-scde/ch25/eccrdcers-deccescde-20-eng.html), the [US Department of State](http://xk.usembassy.gov/), [Switzerland](http://www.bazg.admin.ch/bazg/de/home/information-firmen/befreiungen--verguenstigungen--zollpraeferenzen-und-ausfuhrbeitr/einfuhr-in-die-schweiz/entwicklungslaender-aps-gsp--generalized-system-of-preferences-/visumsstellen-fuer-form-a/europa.html), the [European Commission](http://ec.europa.eu/eurostat/statistics-explained/index.php?title=Glossary:Country_codes), the [Deutsche Bundesbank](http://www.bundesbank.de/resource/blob/825312/daf1dfd5cba969a651eed5c410a4fe43/mL/2020-04-codes-data.pdf), [Ireland](http://www.revenue.ie/en/customs/documents/electronic/aep-trader-guide-appendix-4.pdf), [France](http://www.douane.gouv.fr/fiche/liste-des-accords-et-preferences-unilaterales-de-lunion-europeenne#Balkans), [Malta](http://customs.gov.mt/docs/default-source/business-library-(authorised-economic-operators)/country-codes-new.pdf), the [People’s Republic of China](http://www.mof.gov.cy/mof/customs/customs.nsf/All/5AF08F6CEE8A4408422577B20041642A/$file/1%20ICS%20Country%20codes.pdf), and others. (Contrariwise, [US Customs](http://www.cbp.gov/sites/default/files/assets/documents/2021-Jan/ACE%20AESTIR%20Appendix%20C%20_01142021_508C.pdf) uses ‘KV’.)

XPT.Svg: <svg width='6.58228' height='13' viewBox='-20 -39.5 40 79' id='XPT' xmlns='http://www.w3.org/2000/svg'><rect fill='#D95B14' x='-20' y='-39.5' width='40' height='79' rx='6'/><rect fill='#C7C7C7' x='-16' y='-35.5' width='32' height='71' rx='2'/></svg>

Notes.Mnemonic: In the proportions of a [Royal Mint Refinery 1kg platinum bar](https://web.archive.org/web/20210515224532/https://www.royalmint.com/invest/bullion/bullion-bars/platinum-bars/1-kg-platinum-bar-minted/), edged with the [colour](http://goldrefiningforum.com/threads/colours-of-pt-and-pd-compounds.31666/) of H₂PtCl₆ = [hexachloroplatinic acid](http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Chloroplatinic_acid).

The [logo of the European Investment Bank](https://www.eib.org/en/stories/eib-new-logo) includes an arch, referring to the building, which seems to be about a third of a 5∶4 ellipse. The marker is the whole ellipse, with horizonal lines to further echo the logo, in logo colours. Bbg ticker = <kbd>EIB Corp</kbd>

Notes.Mnemonic: From the [flag of Cameroon](http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Flag_of_Cameroon).
Star from [flag](http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Flag_of_the_United_States); thick black edge so that most important currency has maximum contrast.
Notes.Design: Slightly larger than other markers, as USD is the most important currency.

Notes.Mnemonic: Shape from `USD` marker; pink-purple replacing white.
Notes.UseFor: When showing Sᴛʀɪᴘs separately, the **p**ink-**p**urple variant should be **p**rincipals.

Notes.Mnemonic: Shape from `USD` marker; cyan replacing white.
Notes.UseFor: When showing Sᴛʀɪᴘs separately, the **c**yan variant should be **c**oupons.

Notes.Mnemonic: As for `EUR` = €, except the horizontal line replaced by a star from the [flag of Europe](http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Flag_of_Europe), which is used as the flag of the European Union.
Notes.UseFor: If distinguishing the various EU bond programs, the `EU` marker should be used for the [NGEU](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Next_Generation_EU) bonds.

Notes.Mnemonic: Shape from `EU` marker; with green.
Notes.UseFor: The EU has an alternate marker, `EU_2`, which can be used for green bonds, or for other purposes.

Notes.Mnemonic: Shape from `EU` marker; with blue and yellow from the [flag of Europe](http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Flag_of_Europe).
Notes.UseFor: The EU has an alternate marker, `EU_3`, which can be used for SURE bonds, or for other purposes.

Notes.Mnemonic: Shape from `EU` marker; with blue from the [flag of Europe](http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Flag_of_Europe).
Notes.UseFor: The EU has an alternate marker, `EU_4`, which can be used for EMTN bonds, or for other purposes.

Notes.Mnemonic: Five-pointed star from the [flag of New Zealand](http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Flag_of_New_Zealand#Specifications).

The five-pointed star on the [flag of the People’s Republic of China](http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Flag_of_China#Construction_details,_sizes_and_colors) that has the least vertical orientation: second down of smalls, rotation = ArcTan[−7/−1] ≈ 98.13°.
White star from the [flag of Singapore](http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Flag_of_Singapore); circle and colour from logo of [MAS](http://www.mas.gov.sg/) = Monetary Authority of Singapore.
From the [flag of Pakistan](http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Flag_of_Pakistan), five-pointed star rotated by ArcTan[9/8] ≈ 48.366°.
From the [flag of Türkiye](http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Flag_of_Turkey#Dimensions).
From the 2009 [flag of Ethiopia](http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Flag_of_Ethiopia).
Star from the [flag of Tunisia](http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Flag_of_Tunisia).
Star from the [flag of Morocco](http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Flag_of_Morocco), the bright red being taken from the [coat of arms](http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Coat_of_arms_of_Morocco).

All the points of the red star touch the boundary of the green (four inside, one outside), a property of two of the points of the star in the [flag of Algeria](http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Flag_of_Algeria) = Dzair.
Notes.Design: The rectangles have rotational symmetry of order 2, the star of order 5, all with the same centres, but the whole does not have rotational symmetry.

Notes.Mnemonic: From the [coat of arms of Ghana](http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Ghana#/media/File:Coat_of_arms_of_Ghana.svg).
From the [flag of Senegal](http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Flag_of_Senegal).
From the [flag of Chile](http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Flag_of_Chile#Construction).
Notes.Design: The square has rotational symmetry of order 4, the star of order 5, with the same centres, but the whole does not have rotational symmetry.

Notes.Mnemonic: From the [flag of Panama](http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Flag_of_Panama).
Notes.Design: The square has rotational symmetry of order 4, the star of order 5, with the same centres, but the whole does not have rotational symmetry.

Notes.Mnemonic: Star and colours from the [flag of Venezuela](http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Flag_of_Venezuela).
From the [flag of North Korea](http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Flag_of_North_Korea). The line uses black instead of white, as allowed {white, red, blue} combinations taken by countries with higher GDP.
Stars from the [flag of Syria](http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Flag_of_Syria), in flag colours.
Colours and pieces from the [flag of Uzbekistan](http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Flag_of_Uzbekistan): crescent moon duplicated for symmetry, and a star.

Notes.Mnemonic: From the [emblem of Turkmenistan](http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Emblem_of_Turkmenistan).

Notes.Mnemonic: [Flag of Uruguay](http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Flag_of_Uruguay) has four blue stripes, two of which have ratio 17∶2.

VND.Svg: <svg width='11.952' height='8.3' viewBox='-36 -25 72 50' id='VND' xmlns='http://www.w3.org/2000/svg'><ellipse fill='#DA251D' rx='36' ry='25'/><ellipse fill='#FF0' rx='28' ry='17'/></svg>

Notes.Mnemonic: Banded oval from logo of [State Bank of Vietnam](http://www.sbv.gov.vn/webcenter/portal/en/); colours from [flag](http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Flag_of_Vietnam).

Two silver bars, width∶height at 13∶8, undercut ≈ 10°, these from the centres of allowed ranges in the [Good Delivery rules](http://www.lbma.org.uk/publications/good-delivery-rules/technical-specifications); stacked as for `XAU`.

Two gold bars, width∶height at 2∶1, undercut ≈ 15°, these from the centres of allowed ranges in the [Good Delivery rules](http://www.lbma.org.uk/publications/good-delivery-rules/technical-specifications). Stacked as pictured by the BBC in [Bank of England gold: Rare look inside the vaults](http://www.bbc.co.uk/news/av/uk-51416500), 10 Feb 2020. Also, this stacking hints at the shape of an ‘X’, as in XAU.

XDR.Svg: <svg width='8.65714' height='10.1' viewBox='-12 -14 24 28' id='XDR' xmlns='http://www.w3.org/2000/svg'><path fill='#004C97' d='M12 14V4H6V-4h6V-14H-12V-4h6V4h-6V14Z'/><path fill='#FFF' d='M10 12V6H4V-6h6v-6H-10v6h6V6h-6v6Z'/></svg>

Notes.Mnemonic: Inspired by the ‘I’ in the [logo](http://www.imf.org/-/media/Images/IMF/Data/imf-seal-shadow-sep2019-update-svg.ashx) of the [International Monetary Fund](http://www.imf.org/en/), which issues XDR = [Special drawing rights](http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Special_drawing_rights).
Notes.UseFor: Can be used as a marker for the IMF itself.

Notes.Mnemonic: Outer shape inspired by a motif from the Marib Dam in the [emblem of Yemen](http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Emblem_of_Yemen), plus extra ‘stones’ echoing their placement in the [actual Marib Dam](http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Marib_Dam).
Symmetrified [flag](http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Flag_of_South_Africa); orange as distinctive South African colour.
